metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0386 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - high.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel, where unauthorized access to the execution of the setuid file with capabilities was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s OverlayFS subsystem in how a user copies a capable file from a nosuid mount into another mount. This uid mapping bug allows a local user to escalate their privileges on the system. It was discovered that the OverlayFS implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly handle copy up operation in some conditions. A local attacker could possibly use this to gain elevated privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0386` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-70-generic - 5.15.0-70.77
linux-image-5.15.0-70-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-70.77
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-70-generic - 5.15.0-70.77
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-70-generic-64k - 5.15.0-70.77
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1034-aws - 5.15.0-1034.38
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-aws - 6.2.0-1005.5~22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-70.77').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1034.38').
linux-aws-6.2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1005.5~22.04.1').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1036.43').
linux-azure-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
